block.p: International 3-18
International 3-18

RABIN KILLER'S PLOT EMERGING The picture emerging from the investigation of the killer of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin is of a new underground that was planning acts of terror to derail Israel's peace accord with Palestinians. 1 A soldier and his father were arrested in the inquiry. 12
KOREA'S WATERGATE The former President of Korea has gone from national hero to a man apparently on his way to jail, as the centerpiece of a corruption scandal, despite Korea's graft tradition. 1
IN TIBET, A NEW OLD HORSE A new breed of small horse has been discovered in Tibet, and the horses are believed to be of an ancient breed previously unknown to scientists. 3

EMBATTLED GUATEMALA TO VOTE Guatemala will vote for president Sunday in a campaign that has been peaceful, but the military clearly is still in control, and violence is never far in the background. 16

NIGERIA CHOSE ISOLATION Despite the strong international disapproval, Nigeria's executions were a signal that it was willing to take the risks for internal political reasons. News analysis. 18 Germany lifted a ban on cultivating hemp. 13
National 22-40

NO MOVE TOWARD COMPROMISE President Clinton and leaders of Congress tried to reach an agreement to avert a Government shutdown and a possible default, but they could not even agree to discuss their differences. 1
The budget negotiations remind some of "High Noon." 36
THE POWELL PROCESS A tantalizing couple of days led up to Gen. Colin L. Powell's decision not to run for President. 1

A NEW PARAMILITARY DIRECTION Paramilitary groups, which until now have focused on the Federal Government and the United Nations, are using a new tactic, looking toward local government for sinister plots. 22
OLYMPIC ISSUES Atlanta is finding that being host of the Olympics means wrestling with licensing controversies. 22
FUROR OVER BETTING PARLOR A restaurant's conversion to off-track betting has a scenic Maryland community up in arms. 22
GOVERNOR UNDER A CLOUD Gov. Lawton Chiles of Florida, who has taken pride in running clean campaigns for nearly four decades, now finds his ethics being questioned. 39
Metro 41-50
PERSISTENCE OF HOMELESSNESS New York City's homeless population is less visible than in the 1980's, but officials acknowledge that there is no evidence of a radical decline in their numbers. 1
A CITY'S SALUTE Tens of thousands of American warriors marched out of the past and up Fifth Avenue in New York's largest Veterans Day Parade since the end of World War II. 1
CHANGES AT POLICE ACADEMY Realistic training and open reflection about all that is wrong with the New York Police Department have become new academic staples at the Police Academy. 41

A RIFT OVER GAMBLING Trapped in the poor southeastern corner of Fairfield County, the people of Bridgeport, Conn., are pinning their hopes for economic salvation on a casino -- and on an unlikely ally, Gov. John G. Rowland. 41
Obituaries 52
Elias Schwarzbart, lawyer.
